  <description>
    <facet>
      <vocabularyID>LRE.expressionDescriptionFacetValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>main</value>
    </facet>
    <metadata>
      <schema>http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM</schema>
      <lom xsi:schemaLocation="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/lomv1.0/lomLoose.xsd" xmlns="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM">
        <general>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oercommons.org</catalog>
            <entry>1765087279</entry>
          </identifier>
          <title>
            <string language="en">A Chinese Immigrant Makes His Home in Turn-of-the-Century America</string>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Ein chinesischer Immigrant bildet sein Haus in der 
Jahrhundertwende Amerika</string>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Un immigré chinois fait sa maison en 
Tourner-de-le-Siècle Amérique</string>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Um immigrant chinês faz sua HOME no 
Gir-$$$-$$$-Século América</string>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Un immigrante cinese fa la sua sede nel 
Gir-de-$$$-Secolo America</string>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Ένας κινεζικός μετανάστης κάνει τη "Οικία" του στον 
στροφή-$$$-Ο-ΑΙΏΝΑ Αμερική</string>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Un inmigrante chino hace su hogar en el Dar 
vuelta-de-$$$-Siglo América</string>
          </title>
          <description>
            <string language="en">In this autobiographical sketch published in 1903 in the  Independent  magazine (which ran a series of about eighty short autobiographical "lifelets" of "undistinguished Americans" between 1902 and 1906), Chinese immigrant Lee Chew looked back on his passage to America, and his years as a launderer and merchant on both the East and West coasts.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">Humanities</string>
          </keyword>
          <language>en</language>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-de">In dieser autobiographischen Skizze 
veröffentlichte 1903 in der unabhängigen Zeitschrift (der eine Reihe
von ungefähr achtzig kurzen autobiographischen "lifelets" von 
"undistinguished Amerikaner" zwischen 1902 und 1906 laufen ließ), 
chinesische einwandernde Schutze kauen zurück geschauen auf seinem 
Durchgang nach Amerika und seinen Jahren als launderer und Kaufmann 
auf den Ost- und Westküsten.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Dans ce croquis autobiographique a édité en 1903
dans le magasin indépendant (qui a exécuté une série d'environ 
quatre-vingts "lifelets" autobiographiques courts "des Américains 
médiocres" entre 1902 et 1906), lie immigrée chinoise mâchent 
regardé en arrière son passage en Amérique, et ses années en tant 
qu'un blanchisseur et négociant sur les côtes est et occidentales.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Neste esboço autobiographical publicou em 1903 no
compartimento independente (de que funcionou uma série de 
aproximadamente eighty "lifelets autobiographical curtos" 
"undistinguished americanos" entre 1902 e 1906), lee immigrant 
chineses chew olhado para trás em sua passagem a América, e em seus 
anos como um launderer e um comerciante  nas costas do leste e 
ocidentais.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-it">In questo abbozzo autobiografico ha pubblicato in 
1903 nello scomparto indipendente (di cui ha fatto funzionare una 
serie di circa ottanta "lifelets" autobiografici corti 
"undistinguished gli Americani" fra 1902 e 1906), rifugi immigrati 
cinesi masticano guardato indietro sul suo passaggio in America e 
sui suoi anni come un launderer e commerciante sia sui litorali 
orientali che ad ovest.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Σε αυτό το αυτοβιογραφικό σκίτσο που δημοσιεύθηκε το 
1903 στο ανεξάρτητο περιοδικό (που έτρεξε μια σειρά περίπου 
ογδόντα κοντών αυτοβιογραφικών "lifelets" "undistinguished 
Αμερικανών" μεταξύ 1902 και 1906), ο κινεζικός που έχουν 
μεταναστεύσει Lee Chew ξανακοίταξε στη μετάβασή του στην 
Αμερική, και τα έτη του ως πλύστης και έμπορος και στις ακτές 
ανατολής και δύσης.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-es">En este bosquejo autobiográfico publicó en 1903 
en el compartimiento Independiente (de el cual ejecutó una serie de 
cerca de ochenta "lifelets autobiográficos cortos" "undistinguished a
americanos" entre 1902 y 1906), las heces inmigrantes chinas mastican 
mirado detrás en su paso a América, y sus años como un launderer y 
comerciante en las costas del este y del oeste.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Menschlichkeit</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Sciences humaines</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Humanities</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Studi umanistici</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Ανθρωπότητες</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Humanidad</string>
          </keyword>
        </general>
        <lifeCycle>
          <contribute>
            <role>
              <source>roleValues</source>
              <value>author</value>
            </role>
            <entity>BEGIN:VCARD
N:CENTER FOR HISTORY AND NEW MEDIA/AMERICAN SOCIAL HISTORY PROJECT
FN:CENTER FOR HISTORY AND NEW MEDIA/AMERICAN SOCIAL HISTORY PROJECT
VERSION:3.0
END:VCARD</entity>
          </contribute>
        </lifeCycle>
        <metaMetadata>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oercommons.org</catalog>

          </identifier>
          <language>en</language>
        </metaMetadata>
        <educational>

        </educational>
        <rights>
          <copyrightAndOtherRestrictions>
            <source>copyrightAndOtherRestrictionsValues</source>
            <value>no</value>
          </copyrightAndOtherRestrictions>

            <string language="en">No License</string>
          </description>
        </rights>
      </lom>
    </metadata>
  </description>
